name: Hotel Constanza Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a weekend in Barcelona, and the Hotel Constanza was a winner! Clean and modern, with sleek decor and a lovely rainfall shower. Big balcony with seating. The location was good, three (long) blocks from Plaza Catalunya, so taking the Aerobus from the airport was cheap and convenient. Service was great, and a decent breakfast buffet is included in the price.
reviews.title: Modern with Great Service

likes.disliked: — No wifi access in room, but ethernet cable was provided

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Hotel Constanza. The room was modern, clean and spacious for European standards. We had a balcony that was huge! The location was great- very close to the subway. The staff were really helpful and very friendly. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at Hotel Constanza.
reviews.title: Great stay at Hotel Constanza

likes.liked: — Great location, clean and modern rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Constanza was a struggle to find since the taxi driver was convinced that there was no hotel on Carrier de Bruc. However, once found the staff greeted us warmly and checked us into our room.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the Constanza is currently under refurbishment hence the cheaper room rates but this did not intrude on our stay. The noise levels other reviews have mentioned were not as high as I anticipated ( maybe we were lucky and had free rooms on either side of ours)
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very clean and had a contemporary feel to the decoration. The balcony was a nice touch and the staff were very helpful in bringing us an iron to the room.
reviews.title: good but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has good location, nice rooms, friendly staff, very modern and updated, good price, an over-all good experience. We emailed the hotel directly and received a decent pricing for a suite. Upon arrive the staff was friendly and continued that way through our three plus days. Rooms were big, clean, and updated. The hotel is located two/three blocks from the main square and a block from the Metro. The main district is in walking distance, plenty or stores, and places to eat. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good hotel with competitive price.
reviews.title: Really Liked This Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Hotel Constanza is 5-minute walk from Urquinaona Metro Station (exit Bruc). The street is lined with fashion boutiques, so the neighborhood becomes rather quiet at night because everything is closed. Our room was clean, modern, but small. In fact, we were given the smallest double room according to the hotel floor plan which was posted by the elevator. Since our window faced the side of another building, our room was on the dark side. Having said that, the convenient location and cleanliness of the hotel makes our stay a good value.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is amazingly good value, modern and really close to most of the main sights of Barcelona. Whilst our room was not huge it was very stylish - with a great bathroom! The room would not have been out of place in a 4 star hotel - much nicer than you would expect given the reasonable price tag. The reception staff were very helpful and gave us restaurant suggestions for the evenings. Ther only slight criticism of this hotel was the noise between rooms: you could hear other people's conversations at times. However, this was by no means a big problem.
reviews.title: Great, stylish, central hotel. Good for all the sights.

likes.liked: — The location and the modern feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great small hotel, in a brilliant location. Would definitely recommend it if you''re planning a short break to Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very stylish, quiet and convenient

likes.disliked: — dangerous glass door with no markings on it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in March 08 for a surprise long weekend. Hotel is undergoing refurbishment so there is some building noise, but the deal we got reflected that (so I'm told). The reception area is very chic, a real boutique hotel, as are the bedrooms, bathrooms etc. Beware of the glass door into reception! My OH walked straight into it about 10 minutes after we arrived and nearly brained himself. Sounds funny? it wasn't. Lots of blood, thankfully not on their white suede sofas, but put a bit of a damper on the weekend to be honest. (Hotel staff were not particularly helpful, said there was a pharmacy nearby but didn't offer to help and I had to deal with man covered in blood, about to faint by myself) Check if breakfast is included in the price. It wasn't when we were there but this might have been because the restaurant was being refurbished. Noise between rooms is still an issue. Overall though it was a nice place to stay and very convenient for the city. Above all, no late night drunken street noise. Great city for a long weekend, loads to do and see.
reviews.title: Thin walls!! Good value rooms!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel just north of the Gothic district of Barcelona. I can really recommend this hotel as a great base to explore Barcelona. Overall the staff are friendly and very helpful and the rooms lovely.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel, excellant staff and nice district to stay in
i love hotel constanza
reviews.text: Note: When we stayed they were re-developing most of the hotel which meant there was no restaurant/bar or breakfast offered, but the hotel offered an excellant rate to compensate for this. We were advised that we would not experience any noise and as we stayed over a weekend we did not expect any, however around 10am on Saturday morning some building work could be heard, however Sunday was very peaceful.

reviews.title: Very Nice Stay
reviews.text: LOOK & FEEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in a building that was built in the late 1800's, and has a very modern and stylish interior. This can come across as cold if your taste's are not for the very modern!.
reviews.title: Felt right at home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ENTRANCE & RECEPTION
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Hotel Constanza based solely on the reviews on this website. We're a young couple in our twenties and value for money is everything to us! After doing extensive research it seemed that this hotel was our best option for around €100 a night. Infact, several hotels charging much more than this had a lot worse reviews - Hotel Constanza was something like 22nd out of 500+ hotels in Barcelona when I checked this site - and very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Perfect stay at the Constanza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: I used the hotel's online booking system - we planned 5 nights in Barcelona over the New Year so I expected some increase in the normal price. I was pleasantly suprised - each night was €100 for a double suite, and it went up to €130 for NYE and NYD - very reasonable in my opinion.
reviews.title: Unparalleled price-to-quality ratio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a lovely double suite, done up in minimalistic colours and furniture. The beds were comfy and clean, we had a balcony looking to the back of the hotel, and a spotless bathroom. I can't really think of anything to fault the hotel room-wise. One small niggle for me personally was that the room was quite dark, they had spotlights in the ceiling which made it very romantic, but quite dark when you need to do your hair/make up! (Probably just a girly gripe!)
reviews.title: Outstanding Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was served til 10.30am on normal days, and at the lovely time of midday on 1st Jan, which would have been great, except we didn'[t get up til 4pm. Anyway, on the days we did have breakfast, it was fine; toast, cereals, croissants, ham, cheese, pastries etc. Everything you need to fill you up before a day's siteseeing.
reviews.title: Great Room and Great Location

likes.liked: — Great location and quality of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and polite, although we didn't really have much to do with them during our stay.
reviews.title: Highly recommendable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are four reasons why - if went back to Barcelona - we would stay at the Constanza.
reviews.title: Unbelievably Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the location: in a quiet street within 20 minutes' walk of half the tourist attractions, on bus routes taking you everywhere else, and only 10 minutes walk from the bus station for the airport at Gerona.
reviews.title: Clean, contemporary, great location and nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly, the comfort: we had an apartment on the top floor with a kitchen and a terrace - flooded with light, quiet at night, and lots of room to stretch in.
reviews.title: I would return to the Hotel Constanza.

description: PERFECT LOCATION IN THE HEART OF BARCELONAThe hotel Constanza is located in the Eixample district in the centre of Barcelona. It offers modern, contemporary decor and has its own restaurant, "Bruc 33 Tapas".The Bruc 33 Tapas restaurant next to the hotel offers excellent quality, including a range of creative "Tapas". A varied breakfast buffet offers the possibility of special menus for groups; private rooms can also be hired for parties and events.Our friendly staff are always available in the bright, spacious reception area to help you organize excursions and reservations and make your stay as pleasant as possible.Welcome to our designer lounge...the deep leather and velvet sofas, generously proportioned spaces and subtle lighting provide an intimate atmosphere where you can really relax.
